content: The Iranians DO have plenty of legitimate grievances against us - Things that if they had done them to us, we would have quickly (and rightfully) blown them away for. We overthrew their government. We allied ourselves with one of the worst dictators in history (Sadaam) in an unprovoked attack on them. This stuff is not small potatoes. Mr. Obama is quite right to point out that they sponsor terrorism. The US, as a policy, SHOULD prevent them from getting nukes. But this is not a case of "They been evil and we've been good." In fact, as far as allying with Sadaam goes, we played ball with the devil, we cut off our nose to spite our face... Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by rayevinsonsr: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: The Iranians DO have plenty of legitimate grievances against us - Things that if they had done them to us, we would have quickly (and rightfully) blown them away for. We overthrew their government. We allied ourselves with one of the worst dictators in history (Sadaam) in an unprovoked attack on them. This stuff is not small potatoes. Mr. Obama is quite right to point out that they sponsor terrorism. The US, as a policy, SHOULD prevent them from getting nukes. But this is not a case of "They been evil and we've been good." In fact, as far as allying with Sadaam goes, we played ball with the devil, we cut off our nose to spite our face... Dave Name one country neighbored to Iran that allied to them during the 80's. What little bit we did for Saddam is not comparable to the Arabs and Europeans. Credit and some helocopters. The intell was free as charge but look at what would have happened if Khomeini revolution took Iraq. Would Kuwait and Saudi be far behind? Propaganda of fueling the Savak is hogwash, I hope you're not buying into the Great Satan BS. The only ones pulling for Iran were fellow Shiite. Whoa, one more, Jimmy Carter. Jimmy CArter did all that he could to stop the Mullahs, short of war. Would you have supported war? You say we did little to help Iraq. No doubt that's reassuring - But you are mistaken. We prevented them from invading Iraq by sea. We bombed and sank their ships. We supplied Iraq with all the chemical precursors needed for their chemical arms. Do you really call that "little?" Or is this aid somehow excused because others also gave aid to Sadaam? But let's go back further - We overthrew Mousadagh. In other words, we installed a Fascist dictator - Who cares how much money we gave the secret police? Once in power the Shah didn't need our money. Now, none of the above makes the Mullahs of Iran a more attractive group. But they are statements of undisputable fact. Do we want to live in a pretend world? Or can we face up to the truth? Obama has broken the ice. I see no reason for him to "apologise" to Iran, because there has been so much water under the Bridge. Nor do I think that Almidinajad is a suitable negotiatiing partner - Nevertheless, we're not going to get rid of him by building him up, as Mr. Bush built him up. Iranians know their own history, and when Mr. Bush gave his speech demanding they elect anyone but Almdinajad, Mr. Bush assured the election of Almidinajad. People are suppoed to learn from their mistakes, not repeat them. Dave

The islamofascists in Iran, the "12'vers" the Mahdi faithful see this as a SURRENDER message! The ability to meet at some level one on one with Iran in the inferior position has been put back a decade. The nutbars among them (that's most of the leadership) will redouble their efforts tward nuclear weapons, destroying Israel, and sticking their finger in the eye of the "great satan" (that's us) and will attempt to get the Mahdi's return underway. They are STILL at war with us, and we're fiddling with an amature as Rome nears a conflagration again. How perfect is that?

title: Obama Offers 'New Beginning' to Iran

content: The Iranians DO have plenty of legitimate grievances against us - Things that if they had done them to us, we would have quickly (and rightfully) blown them away for. We overthrew their government. We allied ourselves with one of the worst dictators in history (Sadaam) in an unprovoked attack on them. This stuff is not small potatoes. Mr. Obama is quite right to point out that they sponsor terrorism. The US, as a policy, SHOULD prevent them from getting nukes. But this is not a case of "They been evil and we've been good." In fact, as far as allying with Sadaam goes, we played ball with the devil, we cut off our nose to spite our face... Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: The Iranians DO have plenty of legitimate grievances against us - Things that if they had done them to us, we would have quickly (and rightfully) blown them away for. Mr. Obama is quite right to point out that they sponsor terrorism. The US, as a policy, SHOULD prevent them from getting nukes. But this is not a case of "They been evil and we've been good." In fact, as far as allying with Sadaam goes, we played ball with the devil, we cut off our nose to spite our face... Dave Name one country neighbored to Iran that allied to them during the 80's. What little bit we did for Saddam is not comparable to the Arabs and Europeans. Credit and some helocopters. The intell was free as charge but look at what would have happened if Khomeini revolution took Iraq. Would Kuwait and Saudi be far behind? Propaganda of fueling the Savak is hogwash, I hope you're not buying into the Great Satan BS. The only ones pulling for Iran were fellow Shiite. Whoa, one more, Jimmy Carter.

title: Obama Offers 'New Beginning' to Iran

content: quote: Originally posted by rayevinsonsr: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: The Iranians DO have plenty of legitimate grievances against us - Things that if they had done them to us, we would have quickly (and rightfully) blown them away for. We overthrew their government. We allied ourselves with one of the worst dictators in history (Sadaam) in an unprovoked attack on them. This stuff is not small potatoes. Mr. Obama is quite right to point out that they sponsor terrorism. The US, as a policy, SHOULD prevent them from getting nukes. But this is not a case of "They been evil and we've been good." In fact, as far as allying with Sadaam goes, we played ball with the devil, we cut off our nose to spite our face... Dave Name one country neighbored to Iran that allied to them during the 80's. What little bit we did for Saddam is not comparable to the Arabs and Europeans. Credit and some helocopters. The intell was free as charge but look at what would have happened if Khomeini revolution took Iraq. Would Kuwait and Saudi be far behind? Propaganda of fueling the Savak is hogwash, I hope you're not buying into the Great Satan BS. The only ones pulling for Iran were fellow Shiite. Whoa, one more, Jimmy Carter. Jimmy CArter did all that he could to stop the Mullahs, short of war. Would you have supported war? You say we did little to help Iraq. No doubt that's reassuring - But you are mistaken. We prevented them from invading Iraq by sea. We bombed and sank their ships. We supplied Iraq with all the chemical precursors needed for their chemical arms. Do you really call that "little?" Or is this aid somehow excused because others also gave aid to Sadaam? But let's go back further - We overthrew Mousadagh. In other words, we installed a Fascist dictator - Who cares how much money we gave the secret police? Once in power the Shah didn't need our money. Now, none of the above makes the Mullahs of Iran a more attractive group. But they are statements of undisputable fact. Do we want to live in a pretend world? Or can we face up to the truth? Obama has broken the ice. I see no reason for him to "apologise" to Iran, because there has been so much water under the Bridge. Nor do I think that Almidinajad is a suitable negotiatiing partner - Nevertheless, we're not going to get rid of him by building him up, as Mr. Bush built him up. Iranians know their own history, and when Mr. Bush gave his speech demanding they elect anyone but Almdinajad, Mr. Bush assured the election of Almidinajad. People are suppoed to learn from their mistakes, not repeat them. Dave
